main event: A farmer observed a single, dull, grey, elliptical object hovering over a field near his home in Bentley, Michigan on May 6, 1960 at approximately 8:00 p.m.
interesting points: The object remained stationary for about 5 minutes before rapidly accelerating and disappearing from view.
The report includes photographs of a ruler or scale, a rock or meteorite fragment, and a grainy, textured surface.
The report states that after careful investigation, this sighting remains UNIDENTIFIED.

The report also includes information about another sighting in Bentley, Michigan on May 24, 1960, where a woman observed a luminous object about the size of a basketball hovering over a field before rapidly moving straight up and disappearing.
The photographs in the report do not appear to contain any clear images of the UFO itself, but rather appear to be images of various objects and samples.
sighted object: a single, dull, grey, elliptical object
photographs: yes, the report includes photographs of various objects and samples, but no clear images of the UFO itself
